meanings.definition: To determine the total number of something.
meanings.sent1: I will count the apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She asked me to count the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent3: I tried to count the number of times the cat meowed, but it kept moving around.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work can't be counted in mere hours.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked us to count the number of pencils on our desks.

meanings.sent1: Your opinion really does count in this discussion.
meanings.sent2: Every vote counts in an election.
meanings.sent3: Even though it's just a game, every move you make can count towards your victory.
meanings.sent4: Her words counted for more than just advice; they were a source of comfort.
meanings.sent5: In a team, every player's effort counts towards the final score.

meanings.sent1: The count of sheep in the meadow was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The final count of attendees at the event exceeded our expectations.
meanings.sent3: The count of candies in the jar seemed to decrease mysteriously overnight.
meanings.sent4: The count of books in the library was meticulously recorded.
meanings.sent5: The official count of votes determined the winner of the competition.
